pageContext.claim: “Homeland Security has just confirmed that members of the lawless caravan, the one you've been watching, come from 20 different countries and among them criminals and gang members convicted of crimes ranging from armed robbery to sexual assault.”
pageContext.analysis: Any crowd of 7,000 people is going to have some bad apples. Mexican officials have already identified several and deported them, so they are no longer a potential threat. Trump's figure of 300 people is based on a fuzzy news release to justify presidential assertions, and officials refused to explain how the numbers were calculated. Still, numbers issued by DHS — 270 to 470 — are roughly consistent with the percentage of people with criminal pasts — 5 percent — in the 2014 surge. So it may not be completely out of line even if the possible criminality is hyped.
